page.title: 06 LODDINGTON EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The occupations of those replying fell into four main groups. This assumes that each of the 50 households replying had one person who could be called a housewife. The four main groups were: 1. Professional - this included teachers, solicitors, doctors, nurses, veterinery surgeons, civil servants and managers. Total: 12. 2. Blue-collar workers - fire officer, school caretaker, office and shop workers. Total: 17. 3. Industrial workers - motor mechanics, building workers, milkman. Total: 10. 4. Farm workers - Total 3.
